SEARCH
Package controller

Class DoctorManager

Object
DoctorManager
public class DoctorManager extends Object
The DoctorManager class provides methods for managing doctor-related operations, such as viewing and managing availability, medical records, and appointments.
Since:
2024-10-29
Version:
8.10
Author:
Chew En Zee

      doctorID - the ID of the doctor whose schedule will be viewed

      Sets the availability of a doctor's schedule by marking specific time slots as unavailable.
      Parameters:

    • handleAppointmentRequest

      public static void handleAppointmentRequest(Doctor doctor)
      Handles pending appointment requests for a doctor, allowing them to accept or decline each request.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the doctor handling the appointment requests

    • addPatientUnderCare

      public static void addPatientUnderCare(Doctor doctor, Patient patient)
      Adds a patient to a doctor's list of patients under care.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the doctor who will care for the patient
      patient - the patient to be added under the doctor's care

    • removePatientUnderCare

      public static void removePatientUnderCare(Doctor doctor, Patient patient)
      Removes a patient from a doctor's list of patients under care.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the doctor who will no longer care for the patient
      patient - the patient to be removed from the doctor's care

    • getAllPatientUnderCare

      public static List<Patient> getAllPatientUnderCare(Doctor doctor)
      Retrieves a list of all patients under a doctor's care.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the doctor whose patients will be listed
      Returns:
      a list of patients under the specified doctor's care

    • handleUpdateMedicalRecord

      public static void handleUpdateMedicalRecord(Patient patient, String diagnosis, String treatment)
      Updates a patient's medical record with new diagnosis and treatment information.
      Parameters:
      patient - the patient whose medical record will be updated
      diagnosis - the diagnosis to add to the medical record
      treatment - the treatment to add to the medical record
